byline.contributor: Matt Apuzzo contributed reporting from Washington, Campbell Robertson from Baton Rouge, La., and Mitch Smith from Chicago.

abstract: Judge Clifton B Newman declares mistrial in case of former North Charleston, SC, police officer Michael T Slager, who was caught on camera shooting and killing Walter L Scott, after jury said it could not reach unanimous decision; prosecutors say they will seek new trial for Slager and Scott's family says they are confident he will be convicted.
lead_paragraph: Jurors could not agree on the fate of a North Charleston police officer, Michael T. Slager, in the fatal shooting of Walter L. Scott, an unarmed black man.
snippet: Jurors could not agree on the fate of a North Charleston police officer, Michael T. Slager, in the fatal shooting of Walter L. Scott, an unarmed black man....

headline.main: Mistrial for South Carolina Officer Who Shot Walter Scott
headline.print_headline: Mistrial Declared for South Carolina Officer Who Killed Unarmed Black Man
